headline: Hybrid AI will drive 'whole new wave' of opportunity in 2026
summary: TECHnalysis Research, LLC President Bob O'Donnell sits down with Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre on Market Catalysts to discuss one of the biggest tech trends from the AI trade in 2025 — hybrid AI — and the opportunities that it will continue to present in 2026. Also catch Bob O'Donnell's predictions for agentic AI in 2026 — as it relates to cybersecurity usage — and who he anticipates to be Nvidia's (NVDA) biggest competitors next year. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

content.title: Hybrid AI will drive 'whole new wave' of opportunity in 2026
content.description:
TECHnalysis Research, LLC President Bob O'Donnell sits down with Yahoo Finance markets and data editor Jared Blikre on Market Catalysts to discuss one of the biggest tech trends from the AI trade in 2025 — hybrid AI — and the opportunities that it will continue to present in 2026.

Also catch Bob O'Donnell's predictions for agentic AI in 2026 — as it relates to cybersecurity usage — and who he anticipates to be Nvidia's (NVDA) biggest competitors next year.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: Latest News In Cloud AI - Duos Edge AI Expands To Texas And Illinois Markets
summary: Duos Edge AI recently announced its expansion in Texas and entry into the Illinois market, highlighting continued momentum in deploying Edge Data Centers (EDCs) across diverse sectors. The company has added new EDCs in Lubbock, Texas to meet demand and plans to extend its infrastructure to the Greater Chicagoland Area as part of a broader Midwest expansion. These developments underscore the adaptability and scalability of their EDC solutions, catering to varied needs from education to carrier...

headline: Gryphon Investors Completes Sale of 3Cloud to Cognizant
summary: Gryphon Investors ("Gryphon"), a leading middle-market private investment firm, announced today that it has completed the sale of its portfolio company 3Cloud ("the Company"), a highly scaled dedicated Microsoft Azure services provider, to Cognizant Technology Solutions Corporation (NASDAQ: CTSH). The transaction was originally announced on November 13, 2025. Financial terms are not disclosed.

content.title: Gryphon Investors Completes Sale of 3Cloud to Cognizant
content.summary: Gryphon Investors ("Gryphon"), a leading middle-market private investment firm, announced today that it has completed the sale of its portfolio company 3Cloud ("the Company"), a highly scaled dedicated Microsoft Azure services provider, to Cognizant Technology Solutions Corporation (NASDAQ: CTSH). The transaction was originally announced on November 13, 2025. Financial terms are not disclosed.

headline: Is Capital Group Dividend Value ETF Good For Retirees? | CGDV
summary: Retirees seeking dividend income face a fundamental choice: prioritize immediate cash flow or accept lower yield for capital appreciation. headline: AI Stocks Are Doing the Heavy Lifting Today
summary: The Nasdaq Composite was up 0.2%.  The top stocks in the S&P were Sandisk and Micron Technology, along with other firms tied to the AI trade.  For a large chunk of 2024 and 2025, stocks linked to the AI buildout lifted the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, even on days when most stocks were trading sideways.

headline: Chip Stocks Are Rallying, but Software Is Getting Crushed

headline: Big IPOs Could Be Coming in 2026. SpaceX, Anthropic, and OpenAI Are on the List.
summary: The artificial-intelligence revolution is likely to prompt a continued boom in the initial public offering market, with companies like Elon Musk’s SpaceX and xAI, Anthropic, OpenAI, Databricks, and other privately held unicorns as potential candidates to file in 2026.  “Large private growth companies such as xAI, Anthropic, and SpaceX face similar capital intensity, making public markets a likely funding destination,” Jordi Visser, head of AI macro nexus research for 22V Research, wrote in a report.  “The result may be a wave of major IPOs over the next 12 to 18 months.”

content.title: Big IPOs Could Be Coming in 2026. SpaceX, Anthropic, and OpenAI Are on the List.
content.summary: The artificial-intelligence revolution is likely to prompt a continued boom in the initial public offering market, with companies like Elon Musk’s SpaceX and xAI, Anthropic, OpenAI, Databricks, and other privately held unicorns as potential candidates to file in 2026.  “Large private growth companies such as xAI, Anthropic, and SpaceX face similar capital intensity, making public markets a likely funding destination,” Jordi Visser, head of AI macro nexus research for 22V Research, wrote in a report.  “The result may be a wave of major IPOs over the next 12 to 18 months.”

headline: How major US stock indexes fared Friday, 1/2/2026
summary: The Dow rose 319 points, or 0.7%, but the Nasdaq was roughly flat, weighed down by losses for Microsoft and Tesla.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 319.10 points, or 0.7%, to 48,382.39.  The Nasdaq composite fell 6.36 points, or less than 0.1%, to 23,235.63.

content.title: How major US stock indexes fared Friday, 1/2/2026
content.summary: The Dow rose 319 points, or 0.7%, but the Nasdaq was roughly flat, weighed down by losses for Microsoft and Tesla.  The Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 319.10 points, or 0.7%, to 48,382.39.  The Nasdaq composite fell 6.36 points, or less than 0.1%, to 23,235.63.

headline: Wall Street edges higher in a wobbly start to 2026
summary: U.S. stocks eked out small gains on Wall Street Friday in a wobbly day of trading to kick off the new year.  Markets were mostly quiet on the first trading day of 2026, with the influential technology sector driving much of the up-and-down action.  The index was weighed down by losses for Microsoft and Tesla.

The index was weighed down by losses for Microsoft and Tesla.

headline: Energy Stocks, Utilities Take Lead on First Trading Day of 2026, While Tech Lags
summary: Tech stocks such as  Palantir Technologies  AppLovin and  Microsoft  weighed on major indexes Friday, the first day of trading in the new year, while shares of energy, materials and utilities marched higher.  While this week’s trading action was relatively light, and interrupted by the New Year’s Day holiday, investors nevertheless continued to rotate out of many stocks that powered 2025’s gains.  Traders have passed on some of the biggest names in artificial intelligence, in favor of more defensive or diversified picks in a wider array of industries.

content.title: Energy Stocks, Utilities Take Lead on First Trading Day of 2026, While Tech Lags
content.summary: Tech stocks such as  Palantir Technologies  AppLovin and  Microsoft  weighed on major indexes Friday, the first day of trading in the new year, while shares of energy, materials and utilities marched higher. Traders have passed on some of the biggest names in artificial intelligence, in favor of more defensive or diversified picks in a wider array of industries.
